channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Mali's president resigns and dissolves parliament
item.description: Mali's President Ibrahim Boubacar Keïta steps down, after being detained by soldiers, state TV reports.

item.title: A-level and GCSE results: Call for urgent review into grading 'fiasco'
item.description: Education leaders say the public must know "what went wrong" amid continued confusion over grades.

item.title: US stocks hit new high after coronavirus crash
item.description: Wall Street's S&P 500 index is now higher than it was in February before a historic 34% collapse.

item.title: Coronavirus: Labour calls for evictions ban to be extended
item.description: A freeze on evictions, introduced during the coronavirus lockdown, is due to expire on 23 August.

item.title: Chariots of Fire actor Ben Cross dies aged 72
item.description: He was best known for his portrayal of British Olympic athlete Harold Abrahams in the Oscar-winning film.

item.title: US election 2020: What young Democrats think of Joe Biden
item.description: He's half a century older than them, but it's his moderate politics that worries these young voters.

item.title: West Yorkshire Police probe 'I'll choke you out' video
item.description: The footage appears to show a man being restrained and told: "Chill out or I'll choke you out".

item.title: Manchester lockdown party house closed for three months
item.description: About 200 people gathered in the Gorton area of Manchester where police were pelted with missiles.

item.title: Brexit: UK hopeful of EU trade deal next month, says No 10
item.description: UK negotiators will "continue to plug the gaps", the PM's spokesman says, as talks get under way.

item.title: US Postal Service halts controversial changes amid voting furore
item.description: Critics said the policies, now suspended, would have "sabotaged" the 2020 presidential election.

item.title: Pizza Express to close 73 outlets hitting 1,100 jobs
item.description: The chain says it has cut a deal to stay afloat as coronavirus continues to buffet the economy.

item.title: Coronavirus smell loss 'different from cold and flu'
item.description: Covid-19 is not like other typical viral respiratory diseases and has some unique features, say experts.

item.title: 'I'm very anxious about getting back to work'
item.description: Charities say thousands who have been shielding may have to choose between a job and their health.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Missing man' Johnson and a High Street 'bloodbath'
item.description: Exam results fallout gets widespread coverage in Wednesday's papers as Gavin Williamson "clings on".

item.title: Beirut blast: Born without a father
item.description: Two weeks after the explosion that shattered Beirut, we meet families whose lives changed forever.

item.title: How a hologram can show a patient’s heart during surgery
item.description: A hologram that shows a patient’s heart in real-time during surgery could help improve accuracy when treating arrhythmias.

item.title: Ocean-sieving expedition reveals huge amounts of microplastic in the Atlantic
item.description: The expedition found that as much as 21 million tonnes of plastic fragments are suspended in the ocean.

item.title: Wuhan coronavirus: From silent streets to packed pools
item.description: Images of crowds at a waterpark festival show how far the city has moved on from its January lockdown.

item.title: Motorbike handlebar wheelie world speed record broken by 1mph
item.description: Stunt driver Jonny Davies got his bike up to 109.2mph - beating the world record by 1mph.

item.title: Newsbeat has been investigating how social media is being used to sell drugs
item.description: Police say social media bosses would do more if it was their children dying from drugs bought this way.

item.title: Fans flock to save Berlin's cheeky wild boar
item.description: The boar that fled from a nudist now has thousands of campaigners looking to protect her.

item.title: Lego hand comes out of boy's nose after two years
item.description: Samir Anwar was eating a muffin on a day out when he sneezed the 10 mm piece out of his nose.

item.title: Fountainstown Beach: Bioluminescent plankton light up Cork beach
item.description: Bioluminescent plankton light up the waves at Fountainstown Beach, just south of Cork City.

item.title: Coronavirus: The County Tyrone hay bale superheroes
item.description: Wonder Woman, Spiderman and Batman are among the masked crusaders attracting visitors.

item.title: A-levels: Student foresaw exam crisis in winning story
item.description: The Orwell Youth Prize winner says she has "fallen into her own story" about an exam algorithm.

item.title: Coronavirus: Romance scams, the Yahoo boys and my friend Beth
item.description: Security experts warn there's been an increase in online fraud during the coronavirus pandemic

item.title: Kamala Harris speech: Women who paved way for first black female VP hopeful
item.description: How would-be White House women have campaigned and reflected on their pioneering candidacies.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's happening with university admissions?
item.description: The grading fiasco is a new headache for universities already reeling from coronavirus disruption.

item.title: Death Valley: What life is like in the 'hottest place on Earth'
item.description: The Death Valley just saw one of the highest temperatures ever recorded on Earth - 130F (54.4C)

item.title: Belarus on the brink: What now?
item.description: After 26 years under President Lukashenko people in Belarus are demanding change.

item.title: A-levels: How did Gavin Williamson survive exams U-turn?
item.description: The education secretary has kept his job but still faces questions about his handling of exam grades, writes Iain Watson.

item.title: Exam results: How will universities cope with extra students? And other questions
item.description: Are you concerned about your results? Experts answer some of your questions.

item.title: 19th amendment: A 100-year milestone for women... and what comes next
item.description: A hundred years after US women won the right to vote, female candidates reflect on what’s left to do.

item.title: Sajid Javid: Why has the ex-chancellor been allowed to work for JP Morgan?
item.description: The ex-chancellor has taken a job with the US bank, six months after resigning from government.

item.title: Auctioneers see surge in Covid-19 bankruptcy sales
item.description: Auction firm reports "busiest month in 52 years" as stock is sold from businesses going bankrupt.

item.title: Classy PSG beat Leipzig to reach first Champions League final
item.description: Paris St-Germain are through to their first Champions League final courtesy of a deserved 3-0 victory over RB Leipzig

item.title: Celtic thrash KR Reykjavik to progress into next qualifying round
item.description: Celtic score six without reply as they breeze past KR Reykjavik to reach the Champions League second qualifying round.

item.title: Koeman will be new manager, says Barcelona president Bartomeu
item.description: Former Barca player Ronald Koeman will be the new Barcelona boss, says club president Josep Maria Bartomeu.

item.title: Lions tour of 2021 could be postponed if travel restrictions remain
item.description: If international fans are unable to attend, the tour could be pushed back, South African Rugby's chief executive says.

item.title: Bob Willis Trophy round-up - Fuller hat-trick & Essex win again
item.description: Hampshire's James Fuller takes a hat-trick and Worcestershire's Tom Fell hits a century, but Essex top the lot with a third straight win.

item.title: McLaren are first team to sign new Concorde Agreement
item.description: Ferrari, McLaren and Williams says they have signed up to the new Concorde Agreement which will govern Formula 1 from 2021 to 2025.

item.title: Lazio sporting director angered by Silva's Sociedad move
item.description: Lazio sporting director Igli Tare does not have "respect for the man" after former Manchester City midfielder David Silva joined Real Sociedad.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does Covid-19 test-and-trace work?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are now being traced.

item.title: A-levels and GCSEs: How did the exam algorithm work?
item.description: The government has made a U-turn on A-level results in England, but what sparked such controversy?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: France and the Netherlands are the latest places from where people must quarantine on arriving in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new lockdown rules for Preston and other areas?
item.description: Preston has become the latest place to impose restrictions. But how does a local lockdown work?

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.
